headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, X-GitHub-SSO, X-GitHub-Request-Id, Deprecation, Sunset

nodes.body: Thanks for asking the question! This SDK itself does not directly load agent skills, but Codex already supports agent skills. The Codex SDK is currently available only in TypeScript; however, since Codex is a standalone binary, you can also invoke it from a Python script. When used as a tool within an agentic workflow built with this Python SDK, you can still take advantage of agent skills. We may be able to provide more seamless support in the future, but this is the current state.
This one could be useful for codex use cases! https://github.com/openai/openai-agents-python/pull/2320
